addressleaf.section: From my Lorde Thresorer 17 of october 1592

page.lettertext:
fol.343r
[.]
Octo
b
To M
r
Bodly
M
r
Bodley
William Wa
ad
After o
r
hartie commendac
o
ns. Wheras direction was given unto S
r
Nicholas Parker
knight to goe into
Bryttaine
w
th
his companie of
horse wherein hee dothe make some excuse and delaye by reason the
Count Morice
did
send for
stay
him for some cause of Service, wee
have by
her ma
t
expresse order commaunded him againe to put him
selfe in a Readynes all excuses and delayes sett a
te for that purpose
And to the ende there bee no default made, wee have thought good
also to Require yo
w
to give him the lyke straight chardge and to see yt
formed. And yf any of his company be wantinge that the same
maie be supplied out of the companie of
S
r
John Poley
, wherein
(yf occac
o
n serve) yo
w
maie let
the States
or the Count Morice
to understand her Ma
t
meanynge not to alter her former determy-
nac
o
n. And yf there be any of his Companie that are maryed
in those
tes beinge contrary to soche order as hathe ben by us taken
for Retaynynge nowe in those Bandes that have taken wyves
there, yo
w
shall give direction to
S
r
Thomas Sherleyes
deputie
to make staie of soche Intertaynment as may be due unto them
and hereafter to make them no further allowaunce.
So fare yo
w
well. From Hampton Court the 17
th
of October
1592
Yo
r
very lovinge frenndes
William Burghley
William Burghl
Charles Howard
Hunnsdon
John Wolley
